items.title: Zydus’s MedTech plan underlines transformative changes in pharma sector
items.description: Pharma companies are trying to build revenue resilience by adding new business lines

items.title: Ixigo – Is this journey worth the price?
items.description: The anticipated consumption slowdown hasn’t impacted the travel and tourism sector so far

items.title: CLSA maintains 'overweight' on IndusInd Bank despite ongoing uncertainty, says shares can rally 31%
items.description: Over the next few quarters, CLSA said that there will be lingering uncertainty over more skeletons in the closet and management continuity.

items.title: Hindustan Aeronautics: Execution strength, order pipeline to ensure growth
items.description: Anticipated contracts for LCA Mark 1A, Light Combat Helicopters, Advanced Light Helicopters and the like, and improving visibility stand the company in good stead

items.title: Nifty IT enters bear market, sinks 21% from highs to erase Rs 8.4 lakh crore in value
items.description: Given the global uncertainties, investors are highly uncertain regarding the growth outlook of the Indian IT landscape, which depends on exports for revenues.

items.title: Momentum funds, once star performers, are now in a free fall
items.description: Momentum funds have suffered deep cuts in the past three months as the selloff has hurt the category, and experts are advicing investors to consider them only with a longer term investment horizon of more than a year.

items.title: Coromandel Intl shares in focus on plans to acquire 53% stake in NACL Industries
items.description: Coromandel International share price in focus on plans to acquire a 53% stake from NACL's current promoter, KLR Products, for a sum of Rs 820 crore.

items.title: Chart of the Day: IT stock valuations still out of sync with revenue growth rates
items.description: The current revenue estimates indicate notably slower growth in FY25 and FY26 compared to pre-COVID years

items.title: Bharat Electronics shares gain on orders win of Rs 2,463 crore
items.description: Bharat Electronics Share Price | On March 5, the board of directors of the company declared interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per equity share of Re 1 each (150 percent) for the financial year 2024-25.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty above 22,500, Sensex up 190 pts; MTNL gains 15%, autos slip
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Buying is seen in the metal, bank, energy, pharma, while selling is seen in the auto, IT, realty. ONGC, Tata Steel, NTPC, HUL, Bajaj Finserv are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are Shriram Finance, Hindalco, Grasim, Hero MotoCorp, Apollo Hospitals. BSE Midcap and smallcap indices are trading in the red.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: Global stocks rose on Wednesday with U.S. Treasury yields as relief over cooler U.S. inflation in February was countered by uncertainty around U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff policies and their potential impact on inflation and global growth.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Infosys, BEML, Jubilant Pharmova, Bharat Electronics, NACL Industries, Yatra Online, Swelect Energy Systems in focus on 13 March
items.description: Stocks to Watch, Mar 13: Stocks like Tata Steel, NHPC, NTPC Green Energy, Firstsource Solutions, Coromandel International, SP Apparels, Zydus Lifesciences, Jaiprakash Associates, Rollatainers, Satin Creditcare Network, and Ola Electric Mobility will be in focus on March 13.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Crompton Greaves Consumer, Tata Motors, Kotak Mahindra Bank, SRF, ITD Cementation, and others on March 13?
items.description: The benchmark indices are likely to be rangebound in the upcoming sessions. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Brokerages caution against subpar synergies in Zydus Life's acquisition of Amplitude Surgical
items.description: Brokerages deemed Zydus Life's acquisition of Amplitude Surgical as expensive, with subpar synergies that has triggered widespread caution over EPS dilution.

items.title: Should investors bet on IDBI Bank’s disinvestment?
items.description: The real attraction for the potential buyer will be IDBI Bank’s huge deposits of Rs 282,000 crore as of December last year

items.title: MTNL shares skyrocket 16% as asset monetization earns Rs 2,135 crore
items.description: MoS for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar has informed Parliament that both BSNL and MTNL have earned Rs 12,984.86 crore from monetization of assets since 2019.

items.title: Tata Steel shares rise 2% after JPMorgan lifts price target, forecasts 20% upside
items.description: Tata Steel is also one of only three Tata Group stocks to have delivered positive returns this year with its 10 percent upmove.

items.title: Polycab India bags order worth Rs 3000 crore from BSNL under BharatNet
items.description: Polycab will serve as BSNL's Project Implementation Agency (PIA) for design, supply, construction, installation, upgradation, operation, and maintenance of the middle-mile network under BharatNet initiative.

items.title: GuruSpeak: Tanmay Kurtkoti: using trading to create a multi-asset wealth model
items.description: Trading success is not about having the highest win rate. It’s about staying in the game long enough for your edge to play out

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stock that moved the most on March 13
items.description: Benchmark indices ended lower in a volatile session, with Nifty slipping below 22,400 despite positive cues from industrial production and retail inflation data, closing the week nearly a percent lower.

items.title: Tata Motors shares drop 2% as Jaguar Land Rover reportedly shelves India EV factory plans
items.description: This comes amid a downturn in the overall auto sector as February sales data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) failed to impress investors.

items.title: Baroda BNP Paribas MF optimistic on financial inclusion, manufacturing, retail
items.description: The domestic demand remains strong, said Baroda BNP Paribas CIO, giving the hope that Q4FY25 will be promising and exciting.

items.title: Oil India shares gain 4% after Oilfields bill gets nod in Lok Sabha
items.description: It introduces a distinct ‘petroleum lease,’ separates it from mining regulations, and expands the scope of exploration by redefining ‘oils’ to include a wider range of hydrocarbons.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty below 22,400, dragged by IT and banks as macro cheer fades
items.description: Benchmark indices ended the day near the low, with Nifty below 22,400 as concerns around IT and banking shares weighed, with BSE Mid and Smallcap indices shedding 0.7 percent each.

items.title: InfoBeans Technologies shares rise 3% on AI deal with Canada's leading standards organisation
items.description: InfoBeans, which provides enterprise software and AI solutions, said the deal strengthens its position as a key player in AI-driven transformation.

items.title: Bharat Forge shares slump 4 percent fearing demand hit as US EPA rolls back green norms
items.description: US EPA's decision to review proposed green norms set to come into effect from 2027 may dampen the expected surge in pre-buy demand for Bharat Forge's Class 8 trucks in America.

items.title: Market correction likely over as fundamentals turn favorable: Jefferies’ Mahesh Nandurkar
items.description: With the Reserve Bank of India now focusing on improving liquidity, Nandurkar believes the worst of the slowdown is over.

items.title: Wall Street tumbles as Trump’s tariff threats keep investors on edge; Nasdaq sheds over 1%
items.description: Trump, in a post on Truth Social, vowed to impose 200 percent tariffs on European alcoholic beverages in response to the EU’s 50 percent levy on whisky imports.

items.title: FII net sell shares worth Rs 792 crore, DIIs net buyers of Rs 1,723 crore
items.description: Domestic benchmark indices ended the truncated week on a negative note on March 13 as persisting global uncertainties outweighed the optimism emerging from soft inflation prints of India and the US.

items.title: Banks offer best risk-reward, IT stocks still expensive: Jefferies’ Mahesh Nandurkar
items.description: Given the broader market’s correction, with over 100 stocks trading below their long-term averages, Mahesh sees little reason to chase IT stocks at current levels.

items.title: Nasdaq Composite, S&P 500, Dow Jones tumble over 1% as trade tensions and market jitters deepen
items.description: Trade anxieties escalated after former U.S. President Donald Trump threatened a 200 percent tariff on European alcoholic beverages, including wines and champagnes, in response to the EU’s recent 50 percent tariff on American whiskey.
